item.title: Robin add a quote by Bill Cosby
item.description: "I don't know the key to success, but the key to failure is trying to please everyone." -- Bill Cosby

item.title: Robin add a quote by Laurel Thatcher Ulrich
item.description: "Well-behaved women seldom make history." -- Laurel Thatcher Ulrich

item.title: Robin add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Coincidence is God's way of remaining anonymous." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Robin add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The Lord is my shepherd. I shall not want for nothing. He makes me lie down in the green pastures. He greases up my head with oil. He gives me kung-fu in the face of my enemies. Amen" -- Stephen King

item.title: Robin add a quote by Charles Frazier
item.description: "When everything is immediately available and infinitely reproducible, nothing is valuable." -- Charles Frazier

item.title: Robin add a quote by Charles Frazier
item.description: "That's not a thing any of us are granted. To go back. Wipe away what later doesn't suit us and make it the way we wish it. You just go on" -- Charles Frazier

item.title: Robin add a quote by Charles Frazier
item.description: "She always carried a book, though, in case she needed to read a few pages to avoid unwanted conversation." -- Charles Frazier

item.title: Robin add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "You can't deny laughter; when it comes, it plops down in your favorite chair and stays as long as it wants." -- Stephen King

item.title: Robin add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "We lie best when we lie to ourselves." -- Stephen King

item.title: Robin add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "People who try hard to do the right thing always seem mad." -- Stephen King

item.title: Robin add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "I believe most people are essentially good. I know that I am. It's you I'm not entirely sure of." -- Stephen King

item.title: Robin add a quote by Sandra Kring
item.description: "Be like the single blade of grass. For she too, has been trampled on, mowed down, and hit with such bitterly cold stretches that she had to shut down to survive. Yet still she stands upright with dignity, knowing that she endures, and still she dances with the wind." -- Sandra Kring

item.title: Robin add a quote by Sandra Kring
item.description: "It seems to me that after someone sweeps across your life like a red-hot flame, peeling back the shutters that sat over your heart and your mind and setting free your sweetest dreams or your worst nightmares, after things cool down you've got two choices. You can either slip back into your old self, your old life, tucking those things you were too scared to look at back into hiding, or you can keep those parts of yourself out until you get so used to them that they don't scare you anymore and they just become a part of who you are." -- Sandra Kring
